intro: Mauria simplicifolia, commonly known as the simple-leaved mauria, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. Its leaves are simple, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Mauria simplicifolia is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
